entry.title: Newsletter #103
entry.content:
Hi fellas, in the last two weeks we started having tech lightning talks here at Namshi.

Below you can see Shidhin in this (creative) shot while is showing the rest of the gang how React works and how he used it in our latest open-source project Roger.

Talking about Roger, have you checked the blog post “How Namshi builds Docker containers through Docker containers”?

And ofc it’s TechThursday:

  • Netflix.com Adopts Universal JavaScript, Drops Java From Rendering Pipeline

  • Best article about Promises so far

  • Build react native apps faster with reploy

  • Build static golang binaries and package them into minimal docker containers

  • Debugging memory leaks in node.js – a walkthrough

  • Docker hub top 10

  • ES6 and the evolution of javascript

  • Essentials of machine learning algorithms

  • Firefox exploit found in the wild | mozilla security blog

  • Flux vs. mvc (design patterns) — medium

  • Interview qs for javascript developers

  • Introducing docker content trust

  • It’s the future

  • Longevity (or lack thereof) in javascript frameworks

  • Monitoring connect applications

  • Monitoring survey 2015 – tools – kartar.net

  • Now serving the middle east: 4 new data centers, partnerships

  • Polymorphism that just works

  • Promises in javascript

  • Rest, the big lie

  • Substack/regex-adventure

  • The challenges and opportunities of big-data-as-a-service

  • The ultimate guide to forms in angular 2 « ng-book.com – blog

  • Tools to run python bytecode in the browser.

  • Using es.later decorators as mixins

  • We all are going to meet in the elixir world

  • Why debugging is all about understanding — futurice

  • Why do software engineers tend to get into the office so late? – quora

  • Why was erlang chosen for use in facebook chat?

entry.title: Newsletter #98
entry.content:
TechThursday is here!

We really enjoyed the Namshi Iftar this week :)

Hi Guys, the week is over and a we have a the usual list of links for you.
